page.title: 02St. LEODEGAR'S CHURCH
page.content: { St. Leodegar's church According to the{Domesday Book},there was a church on this site in 1086.Two stone-heads were dug up in the churchyard in 1956;these were identified as Normans. It is beleived to be all that is left of the first church. St.Leodegar was a French bishop and it was thought that the church was dedicated to him because Wyberton was given to{Count Alan of Brittany}as part of his reward for fighting in the battle of Hastings. The{Norman}church was replaced in the 13th C.The new church was big and the remains of the big pillars were found,only the bases still stand.It had a tower at the centre of the church between the Nave and the Chancel.In 1419 the tower fell destroying most of the church.
